World Religions & Beliefs.name: Echoes of Faith: A Religious Sampler
World Religions & Beliefs.description: Delve into a diverse range of religious traditions and historical figures with this eclectic quiz. From saints and scriptures to diseases and deities, test your knowledge of the world's beliefs. Can you decipher the echoes of faith?

questions.text: What disease is sometimes referred to as the 'royal disease'?
questions.hint: This condition affected European royalty due to its genetic transmission.

questions.text: Who is the patron saint of animals?
questions.hint: This saint is celebrated for his love of nature and is often depicted with animals.

questions.text: From whom does the Lutheran Church get its name?
questions.hint: This person was a key figure in the Protestant Reformation of the 16th century.

questions.text: What is the last book of the New Testament?
questions.hint: This book describes apocalyptic visions and the end of times.

questions.text: By what collective name do Christians refer to God the Father, God the Son and the Holy Ghost?
questions.hint: This term reflects the three-in-one nature of the Christian Godhead.

questions.text: Girls of what religious community traditionally wear bonnets?
questions.hint: This community is known for its plain dress and simple lifestyle in rural areas.

questions.text: Which of these is not a Hindu deity?
questions.hint: This is a language, not a god, unlike the others, which are part of the Hindu pantheon.

questions.text: According to the Bible, Moses and Aaron had a sister named what?
questions.hint: Her name is associated with a song of praise after crossing the Red Sea.
